title: I dont have cows but mob graze my horses & they do an excellent job.

subtasks: Mob graze horses to reduce thistle seed heads
Chopping thistle parts post-grazing if needed
Understand the timing of thistle chopping
Compare horse versus sheep grazing effects on thistles
Manage hay quality (preserve for silage making)
Deal with thistles in hay fields over time
Use horse manure to fertilize fields
Break horse manure spread using paddock division
Utilize grazing to distribute manure evenly
Segment fields into paddocks for grazing
Move electric fencing to create new paddocks
Ensure access to water for livestock
Cut remaining thistle seed heads at optimal times
Address regrowth of thistles after grazing
Change hay sources to avoid thistles

tasks.task: Thistle management through grazing (horse and sheep), manure and soil improvement (even distribution via rotational grazing), hay sourcing changes, field reseeding, and water trough protection. Each 'maintenance' task is important for the various aspects of agricultural land management they're discussing here.
